entry.title: Armenian Foreign Minister visits India to strengthen ties

media:group.media:title: Armenian Foreign Minister visits India to strengthen ties
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan discusses strengthening relations in India, with interest in cooperation in IT, science, pharmaceuticals, as well as participation in the North-South International Trade Corridor. üìç Protesters in Berlin demanded freedom for Armenian prisoners in Baku ahead of European Parliament debates on the issue. üìç The European Union has authorized Armenia to export high-quality aquaculture finfish and fish products, including caviar and roe, to its member states. üìç PODCAST: Chronicle of a murder foretold- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SG5wcm0-sns

entry.title: Medieval Gospel of Shurishkan is on display in Yerevan #shorts

media:group.media:title: Medieval Gospel of Shurishkan is on display in Yerevan #shorts
media:group.media:description:
The Gospel of Shurishkan, a medieval Armenian manuscript created in the 15th century, is now on display at the Matenadaran museum in Yerevan. The gospel survived centuries of turmoil, including being buried for seven years to protect it from destruction. Now preserved at the Matenadaran, this rare manuscript will be on view for the next month.

üìç Gyumri‚Äôs acting mayor will be a candidate in the municipal election on March 30; he‚Äôll run against multiple opposition parties. üìç The Artsakh rights protection committee, which works toward Artsakh people‚Äôs right to a secure and dignified resettlement in their homeland, is launching international diplomatic efforts. üìç A Hetq investigation reveals that in 2023 the Armenian government invested nearly $4 million in a new company linked to Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan‚Äôs wife, raising concerns of cronyism. üìç ‚ÄúNo one is safe from this kind of extremism‚Äù- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k8Dlq0YWzW4

media:group.media:title: Chronicle of a murder foretold
media:group.media:description:
In this special edition of the CivilNet podcast, commentator Eric Hacopian raises the alarm on Azerbaijan‚Äôs hidden intentions behind the expulsion of the International Committee of the Red Cross, which he believes is to murder Ruben Vardanyan and the other Armenian hostages who are currently enduring sham trials and torture in Baku. He explains what the Armenian government, international partners, and Armenians throughout the world must urgently do to prevent the worst.

entry.title: "No one is safe from this kind of extremism" as Alawites massacred in Syria

media:group.media:title: "No one is safe from this kind of extremism" as Alawites massacred in Syria
media:group.media:description:
Basel Issmail is a resident of Armenia with roots in the coastal regions of Syria, where in recent days hundreds of his fellow Alawis have been massacred by forces with links to the new government, with confirmed casualties continuing to rise. He joined us to talk about the first-hand accounts of the violence he has heard from those close to him still in the Latakia region and to sound the alarm about this ongoing ethnic cleansing. With reports of Armenians having been killed as well, Issmail warns that every minority group in Syria is a potential target.
0:00- Who are the Alawite community in Syria? 2:40- How did the takeover by HTS paramilitary lead to massacres? 5:34- Terrorism being fueled through social media platforms. 6:14- Are other minority groups like Armenians in danger as well? 8:18- Why is there very little reporting on the killings?

media:group.media:title: International Women's Day in Armenia: The Numbers #shorts
media:group.media:description:
March 8 is International Women‚Äôs Day, and in Armenia, it‚Äôs widely celebrated by men giving women flowers, gifts, and even heartfelt speeches. But beyond the joyous celebrations, some are criticizing the holiday‚Äôs superficial nature, in light of the unaddressed challenges women continue to face in Armenia.
